page.title: 05Changing Times.
page.content: Today is different from the 1920's in the respect that a small estate of houses and bungalows has been built on land next to the school and overlooking the yacht basin within the past 15 years. Nothing has changed in respect of farmhouses,churches,school and the two halls in the block - Ellel and Thurnham as regards structure. Thurnham Hall facade and exterior have been renovated and cleaned and much money spent internally before it was opened to the public in 1975. The facade is dressed with stone from Lancaster Castle,and this part of the house was in a very dangerous condition and took two years to restore. Apart from the erection of grain silos on farms,the landscape has remained virtually unchanged for centuries.
